This weakens Black's Q-side.
It's important to kick immediately.
As a result of this game 6... P-KR4 became fashionable.
Geller looked quite happy after his novelty, but sounder is 7... N-B3 8 P-Q4 N-Q2 bolstering the center.
Geller looked quite happy after his novelty, but sounder is 7... N-B3 8 P-Q4 N-Q2 bolstering the center.
I realized the danger inherent in weakening my K-side, but felt that I could capitalize on Black's lack of development [the traffic jam on the K-side] before he could get to my King.
It's worth a Pawn to open up the game.
It's worth a Pawn to open up the game.
The threat was 10 B-KN5 followed by 11 P-Q5 winning a piece. He still looked happy.
An attempt to rehabilitate Geller's line was made in Smyslov-Medina, Tel Aviv 1964, which continued 10... B-Q3 11 BxN ch PxB 12 R-K1 O-O-O, but 13 R-K3! proved to be very strong.
An attempt to rehabilitate Geller's line was made in Smyslov-Medina, Tel Aviv 1964, which continued 10... B-Q3 11 BxN ch PxB 12 R-K1 O-O-O, but 13 R-K3! proved to be very strong.
Trading old advantages for new. Now Black's Q-side Pawns are a shambles and his King can expect no shelter there.

A few weeks after the game it dawned on me that 12 Q-R4 would have been a tremendous shot. I was kicking myself for not playing it, but then I found that after 12 Q-R4 K-Q2! 13 PxP PxP 14 N-B4 B-Q3 White has no immediate way to exploit the exposed King.

A litle surprise, permitting him to open his KR file.
Geller took a half hour on this recapture and stopped looking happy. He rejected 14... RPxN 15 N-K4 Q-R5 16 NxB ch PxN 17 QxP QxRP? 18 R-K1 ch and mates.
Another difficult decision. On 15... N-K2 16 N-B4 O-O-O 17 Q-R4 White's attack comes first.

Still hoping to rise from the ashes and fan his attack.

The best chance is 17... QxN.
The best chance is 17... QxN.
Loses outright. In the post-mortem Mikhail Tal tried to hold the game with 18... R-Q1 19 Q-K2 PxP but after 20 PxP Black is in virtual zugzwang.
